title: 2 Nephi 20
html:
Tools in God's Hand

Synopsis: Destruction of Assyria is a type of destruction of wicked at the Second Coming—Few people shall be left after the Lord comes again—Remnant of Jacob shall return in that day—Compare Isaiah 10.

Who Is Our Guide?

As we have noted, Nephi includes this large block of Isaiah chapters (2 Nephi 12–24) because he "delighteth in proving unto [his] people the truth of the coming of Christ . . . and also [his] soul delighteth in the covenants of the Lord" (2 Nephi 11:4–5).

What Are the Trees?

  • Covenant Israel (chastised for their mistreatment of the poor and widows)
  • Christ (a type of the Lord's Second Coming is described)
  • Current Events (an Assyrian attack is imminent)
  • Coming Events (The Assyrian attack is a type of the Lord's Second Coming)

What Keys Can We Use?

  • Learn the Manner of Prophesying (again, Isaiah uses a current event to describe latter-day conditions)
  • Have the Spirit of Prophecy (read prayerfully)
  • Know the Regions Round About (Isaiah mentions a number of cities within the kingdom of Judah)
  • Live in the Last Days (use modern archaeology and maps to locate ancient cities)

Overview of 2 Nephi 20 in One Paragraph

Social injustices exist in the northern kingdom of Israel. The kingdom of Assyria is an instrument in God's hand to punish Israel. God destroys Assyria, which is a type of the destruction at the Second Coming. A remnant of Israel will return in the last days. Assyria will march toward Jerusalem (in Judah) causing terror, but Jehovah will defend her (Book of Mormon Reference Companion, 376).

Dividing the Tree of 2 Nephi 20 into Branches

  • 1–4: Social injustices exist among covenant Israel
  • 5–11: Assyria is a rod in God's hand to punish covenant Israel
  • 12–19: God destroys Assyria, which is a type of the destruction of the wicked at the Second Coming
  • 20–27: A remnant of covenant Israel will return in the last days
  • 28–34: Back to Isaiah's day: an Assyrian army marches toward Jerusalem
